intro: Veronica bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and alpine meadows, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
